title: signs
comment: Miraculous or supernatural confirmations of the existence and power of God or the miraculous demonstration of spiritual authority on the part of an individual.

children.title: signs, purposes of
children.comment: Signs are given to confirm God's word. They may warn the rebellious or encourage the faithful. People may seek signs as a result of a genuine desire to serve God.

children.title: Signs are given to demonstrate God's power
Signs demonstrate the authority of God's servants
Signs may accompany the preaching of the gospel
Signs may warn the ungodly of impending judgment
Signs may warn God's people against rebellion
By giving assurance of God's presence
By encouraging the fearful and doubting
Signs need hold no terror for the godly
When seeking signs is acceptable to God
When seeking signs is condemnned by God
signs, kinds of
children.comment: Signs are miraculous events, supernatural phenomena or everyday things that are given a special significance. The term is used in John's Gospel to describe the miracles of Jesus Christ.

children.title: The signs of Jesus Christ in John's Gospel

primaryrefs.comment: John refers to the miracles of Jesus Christ as ``signs'' in order to bring out the significance of these deeds.

seealsos.comment: Jesus Christ, the bread of life
Jesus Christ, the light of the world
Jesus Christ, the resurrection and the life
